intro: Xylosteon gibbiflorum, commonly known as the ribbed-flowered woodspur, is a flowering plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, tubular flowers that are typically pink or red in color. Xylosteon gibbiflorum produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
